title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 6, ch. I, subch. A, pt. 2 - More Than One Species
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 6, ch. I, subch. A, pt. 2 - More Than One Species

State Regulations
§ 2.1 - Hunting hours for deer and bear
§ 2.2 - Repealed
§ 2.3 - Hunting with a crossbow
§ 2.4 - Authorization to use a longbow equipped with a mechanical device
§ 2.15 - Fluorescent orange or fluorescent pink requirements for hunting deer and bear

Black, Gray And Fox Squirrels, Raccoon, Cottontail Rabbit, Varying Hare, European Hare, Bobcat, Red Fox, Gray Fox, Coyote, Opossum And Weasel (§ 2.20 to 2.21)

Ruffed Grouse (partridge), Pheasant, Gray (hungarian) Partridge And Quail (§ 2.25 to 2.26)

Migratory Game Birds (§ 2.30)

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 6, ch. I, subch. A, pt. 2

Statutory authority: Environmental Conservation Law, §§11-0303, 11-0713, 11-0901, 11-0907, 11-0929, 11-0933, arts. 11, 13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
